conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t_2, we need to analyze the velocity vs. time graph for both objects A and B.
The velocity vs. time graph for object B shows a curve that starts at a higher velocity and then decreases over time.
The acceleration of an object is the change in velocity over time. Therefore, the acceleration of object B can be calculated by finding the slope of the velocity vs. time graph at any point.
At t_1, the velocity of object B is v_B(t_1). At t_2, the velocity of object B is v_B(t_2).
The acceleration a_B can be calculated using the formula: a_B = (v_B(t_2) - v_B(t_1)) / (t_2 - t_1).
The acceleration of object B decreases over time.
This is because the velocity of object B decreases over time, which means the acceleration is negative.
The acceleration of object B decreases over the time interval 0 to t_2.
The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t_2 is decreasing.
